revision.text:
{{Infobox Game | type = official game | titleN = {{ruby-ja|東方星蓮船|とうほうせいれんせん}} | titleEn = Undefined Fantastic Object | image = [[File:Th12cover.jpg|256px|Undefined Fantastic Object]] | developer1 = [[Team Shanghai Alice]] | publisher1 = [[Team Shanghai Alice]] | publisher1Cat = Team Shanghai Alice | released = Trial 0.01: 2009/03/08
Trial 0.02a: 2009/07/19
Full: 2009/08/15 | convention = Comiket 76 | gameplay = Single-Player Story Mode | platforms = [[Windows]] [[wikipedia:Windows 2000|2000]]/[[wikipedia:Windows XP|XP]]/[[wikipedia:Windows Vista|Vista]] | genre1 = Vertical Danmaku Shooting | requirements = *Pentium 1GHz *450 MB hard disk *Direct3D *DirectX 9 (November 2008) *32MB VRAM *DirectSound *128MB RAM | chronology =Touhou Series | chrono_prev =[[Subterranean Animism]] | chrono_next =[[Touhou Hisoutensoku]] }} {{thtitle|Touhou |Seirensen|ruby=Star Lotus ShipDouble meaning in the title: "Seirensen" is also the pronunciation of "聖輦船" ("Palanquin Ship"), the ship that serves a major role in the game's story.| ~ Undefined Fantastic Object|jp=東方星蓮船　～ Undefined Fantastic Object}} is the twelfth official game of the ''[[Touhou Project]]''. A trial version of the game was released at [[Reitaisai]] 6 in March of 2009. The full game was released at [[Comiket]] 76 in August of 2009 and hit stores on September 11, 2009. It was developed and released alongside ''[[Touhou Hisoutensoku]]''. ==Gameplay== {{Main|/Gameplay|l1=Gameplay|/Gameplay/Strategy|l2=Strategy|/Spell Cards|l3=Spell Cards}} ''Undefined Fantastic Object'' features three playable characters ([[Reimu Hakurei|Reimu]], [[Marisa Kirisame|Marisa]] and [[Sanae Kochiya|Sanae]]), each with two weapon types. Unlike ''[[Mountain of Faith]]'' and ''[[Subterranean Animism]]'', the bomb system from earlier games such as ''[[Perfect Cherry Blossom]]'' and ''[[Imperishable Night]]'' has been reintroduced. ''Undefined Fantastic Object'''s main gimmick lies in the [[Unidentified Flying Object|colored UFOs]]. Certain enemies will release a UFO upon destruction, which the player can collect to obtain more bombs, life pieces, or point bonuses. Scoring generally involves timing UFO outbreaks well and utilizing point-based UFOs over the others. ==Concept== Unlike previous games, which have focused mainly on giving the player a [[Shinto]] feeling, ZUN designed this one with [[Buddhism]] in mind from the very start. There are numerous references to [[Bishamonten]] throughout, as can be seen from [[Shou Toramaru]] and [[Nazrin]]'s background stories and [[Ichirin Kumoi]]'s clothing design.{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=otIrJdoaITI|title=Interview with Chara☆Mel|accessdate=9 March 2011|author=Chara☆Mel|language=ja}} Aside from coming from a different religious angle, one of the major points of the game was to pay homage to ''[[Wikipedia:Space Invaders|Space Invaders]]'', one of the first commercially successful shoot 'em up games. [[ZUN]] worked for [[Wikipedia:Taito Corporation|Taito Corporation]], the company whom originally developed the game, until around 2008, making ''Undefined Fantastic Object'' the first ''Touhou'' game ZUN made since his departure from the company, and 2008 also happened to mark the 30th anniversary of Space Invaders. This influence was part of what went into the idea of UFOs being the main gimmick. It is also clearly shown in [[Stage]] 6, where the [[fairy]] [[stage enemies]] move in a back-and-forth pattern very reminiscent of the classic arcade game. There are also numerous subtle references to the [[PC-98]] games; for example, the main character travels to [[Makai]] after Stage 4, and one of [[Byakuren Hijiri|Byakuren]]'s spell cards references one of [[Shinki]]'s attacks in both pattern and name. Besides referencing older ''Touhou'' games, a few spell cards also borrow their names from other Taito games such as ''[[Wikipedia:Bubble Symphony|Bubble Symphony]]'' ''[[Wikipedia:Bubble Memories|Bubble Memories]]'', and one which references ''[[Wikipedia:Radiant Silvergun|Radiant Silvergun]]'', a shoot-'em-up developed by [[Wikipedia:Treasure (company)|Treasure]]. ==Story== {{Main|/Story|l1=Story|/Translation|l2=Translation|/Characters|l3=Characters}} The story of ''Undefined Fantastic Object'' is about a strange flying object that appears in the skies of Gensokyo during the early springtime. The player character will, for whatever reason their shot type description says, launch off into the sky to unravel its mysteries, plunder its treasure, and generally get rid of youkai. Upon reaching the Stage 4 [[boss]], [[Minamitsu Murasa]], the story begins to unravel. The objective of most of the enemies in the game is to free a human named [[Byakuren Hijiri]] from a sealed sleep of hundreds of years. Interestingly enough, every character besides [[Kogasa Tatara]] has an important role in the plot. Each with their own reasons, the enemies attempt to collect these UFOs - actually fragments of the "floating vault", Tobikura - the player has been collecting, but the player eventually unseals and faces Byakuren herself out of curiosity. After the events of the main story, it is known that Byakuren and her followers erect a Buddhist temple in [[Gensokyo]]. However, in order to figure out what the UFO objects really were, the player later encounters [[Nue Houjuu]], who reveals that she was the one aiding and obstructing both the player and enemy factions during the main story. The reason the fragments of Tobikura had been scattered was because she had placed [[Seed of Unknown Form|Seeds of Unknown Form]] in them, and the reason they appeared to be UFOs was essentially because nothing else should be floating through the sky like that. ==Music== {{Main|/Music|l1=Music}} ''Undefined Fantastic Object'' has 17 different tracks in it excluding the ''Player Score'' song, which can all be unlocked in the sound test by hearing them at least once in-game. Of all the different songs, [[ZUN]] specially noted the Stage 1 theme "At the End of Spring" ({{lang|ja|春の湊に}}), the final boss theme "Emotional Skyscraper ~ Cosmic Mind" ({{lang|ja|感情の摩天楼　～}} Cosmic Mind), and the extra stage theme "UFO Romance in the Night Sky" ({{lang|ja|夜空のユーフォーロマンス}}) as particularly important. The staff roll theme "Returning Home From the Sky ~ Sky Dream" ({{lang|ja|空の帰り道　～}} Sky Dream) is an arranged version of "Emotional Skyscraper ~ Cosmic Mind". According to ZUN, the stage 1 theme is always the first composed, so he put a lot of time into it in order to extensively test the game system; the introduction of ''At the End of Spring'' happens to include pieces of a song he wrote (and possibly never used) during his time at university. He also claims he sometimes thinks he worked way too hard on ''Emotional Skyscraper ~ Cosmic Mind'', implying it may sound like he's trying to be cool. He says he had a fun time composing ''UFO Romance in the Night Sky'', as well, because by that time the main game has been finished and he could "do something different". ==Press== ''Undefined Fantastic Object'' was originally announced on February 26, 2009, along with a few in-progress screenshots and a simple explanation of the game's story. {{cite web|url=http://kourindou.exblog.jp/9703480/|title=記念すべき東方Project第１２弾　東方星蓮船|author=ZUN|publisher=kourindou.exblog.jp|language=ja|accessdate=9 March 2011}} A trial was later released at [[Reitaisai 6]] on March 8. A downloadable trial version, containing the finished versions of stages one through three, was released to the public on July 19, prior to the game's final release on August 15 at [[Comiket 76]]. Shortly after the full release, on August 27, a patch was released to fix a scoring [[glitch]] and to slightly change the color of one UFO in order to make the game more accessible to colorblind players. An English-language patch for the full version was released on September 8, 2009 at Gensokyo.org{{cite web|url=http://www.gensokyo.org/archives/1032|title=UFO English Patch v1.0 Released!|publisher=gensokyo.org|accessdate=9 March 2011}}, three days before the game was released in doujin stores across Japan. In the February issue (volume 11) of the magazine [[Chara☆Mel]], which has in the past serialized the ''[[Cage in Lunatic Runagate]]'' short stories, there was an interview with [[ZUN]] in the form of an attached DVD. During the interview, ZUN details the ideas and concepts that went into the creation of ''Undefined Fantastic Object'', as well as character design specifics and his thoughts on the music. ===Virus on Steam Version=== On June 5, 2020, a post was made in the ''Undefined Fantastic Object'' Discussion Board on Steam about the game containing malware called [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DarkHotel DarkHotel], which was mainly used for Hotel Wi-Fis for phishing and keylogging.https://steamcommunity.com/app/1100160/discussions/0/2292842508233570396/ On December 18, 2020, the distribution for the game was halted, though it later returned on January 21, 2021.https://steamcommunity.com/app/1100160/allnews/ ==English patches== {{thcrap|th12|http://www.mediafire.com/download/bhf17ha6jj74czw/th12_%28thpatch-en%29.zip}} *[http://www.gensokyo.org/archives/1032 Alternative English static patch from Gensokyo.org] ==External Links== ===Official=== *[http://www16.big.or.jp/~zun/html/th12top.html Official website at Team Shanghai Alice] *[http://www16.big.or.jp/~zun/html/th12dl.html Download page for trial version and 1.00b patch at Team Shanghai Alice] *[http://kourindou.exblog.jp/9703480/ Original article at Invisible Games and Japanese] *[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=otIrJdoaITI ZUN's interview with Chara☆Mel regarding Undefined Fantastic Object at Youtube] *[https://store.steampowered.com/app/1100160 Steam] ===Unofficial=== *[http://shmups.system11.org/viewtopic.php?t=34763 English scoreboard at Shmups Forum] *[http://www.shrinemaiden.org/forum/index.php?topic=163 English scoreboard at Maidens of the Kaleidoscope] *[http://score.royalflare.net/th12/ Japanese scoreboard at Royal Flare] ==Additional Information== *The game's Japanese name ({{lang|ja|'''星蓮'''船}}) contains the character for "lotus" ({{lang|ja|蓮}}) in [[Byakuren Hijiri]]'s given name ({{lang|ja|白'''蓮'''}}) and the character for "star" that makes [[Shou Toramaru]]'s given name ({{lang|ja|星}}). Byakuren's surname, Hijiri ({{lang|ja|聖}}) is formed by one of the radicals in {{lang|ja|星}} and both can be pronounced "sei", following the trend of mainline games' names referencing their final bosses or other important characters. ==References== {{smallrefs}} {{Navbox Touhou}} {{Navbox UFO}} [[de:Undefined Fantastic Object]] [[es:Undefined Fantastic Object]] [[fr:Undefined Fantastic Object]] [[vi:Undefined Fantastic Object]] [[pl:Undefined Fantastic Object]] [[pt:Undefined Fantastic Object]] [[ru:Undefined Fantastic Object]] [[tr:Undefined Fantastic Object]] [[uk:Undefined Fantastic Object]] [[zh:东方星莲船]] [[ko:동방성련선]] [[Category:Reitaisai 6]] [[Category:Undefined Fantastic Object| ]]

{{Infobox Game | type = official game | titleN = {{ruby-ja|東方深秘録|とうほう しん ぴろく}} | titleEn = Urban Legend in Limbo | image = [[File:Th145front.jpg|256px|Urban Legend in Limbo]] | developer1 =[[Twilight Frontier]] | developer2 =[[Team Shanghai Alice]] | publisher1 =[[Twilight Frontier]] | publisher2 =[[Team Shanghai Alice]] | publisher1Cat=Twilight Frontier | publisher2Cat=Team Shanghai Alice | released = Original version:
Trial: 2014/12/29 ([[:Category:Comiket 87|Comiket 87]])
Web trial: 2015/05/03
Full version: 2015/05/10 | released2 = PlayStation 4 version:
2016/12/08 | convention = Reitaisai 12 | convention2 = | genre1 = Competitive | genre2 = Fighting | gameplay = | platforms = [[Windows]] [[wikipedia:Windows Vista|Vista]]/[[wikipedia:Windows 7|7]]/[[wikipedia:Windows 8|8]]
[[wikipedia:PlayStation 4|PlayStation 4]] | requirements =Windows: *CPU: multi-core 2GHz+ *Memory: 2GB+ *Installed capacity: 200MB *Video Card: DirectX9.0c, more than VRAM512MB corresponding to ShaderModel2.0 :(onboard graphics will be operation-guarantee excluded) *Display: 1280×720 resolution
1920x1080 resolution (PlayStation 4 only) *Sound: corresponding to DirectSound *DirectX: DirectX9.0c+ *Input Devices: Keyboard, gamepad PlayStation 4: *Sony PlayStation 4 | chronology =Touhou Series | chrono_prev =[[Impossible Spell Card]] | chrono_next =[[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]] }} {{thtitle|Touhou |Shinpiroku|ruby=Deep Secret Record| ~ Urban Legend in Limbo|jp=東方深秘録　～ Urban Legend in Limbo}} is the 14.5th official installment of the ''[[Touhou Project]]'', released on May 10, 2015. A trial version of the game was released on December 29, 2014, showing [[Reimu Hakurei]], [[Marisa Kirisame]] and [[Kasen Ibaraki]] as playable characters. It is the fifth fighting game collaboration between [[Team Shanghai Alice]] and [[Twilight Frontier]]. A PlayStation 4 version was released after a year since its initial release, as part of [[Play, Doujin!]]. The PlayStation 4 version features [[Reisen Udongein Inaba]] as an exclusive character with her own story following the events after [[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]]. This marks the first official Touhou game to be released on consoles. ==Gameplay== {{Main|/Gameplay|l1=Gameplay|/Spell Cards|l2=Spell Cards}} ==Concept== The game features a similar style and gameplay to the previous fighter ''[[Hopeless Masquerade]]''. One exception is the use of [[Moe Harukawa]], artist of ''[[Forbidden Scrollery]]'', as the game's portrait artist. She replaces longtime artist [[alphes]], who previously served as the artist on all of Touhou's fighting games. With this, a recurring theme in the game is using [[wikipedia:Manga|manga]]-style graphics, where each introduction to an opponent shows them drawn in a manga-style way. ===Name=== Before its first announcement with [[Twilight Frontier]], there were only English words in its title. An "[[Wikipedia:Urban legend|urban legend]]" refers to a modern folklore story, usually false, but believed by many regardless. "[[Wikipedia:Limbo|Limbo]]" in [[Wikipedia:Catholic theology|Catholic theology]] is an idea that there exists a separate, less "damning" afterlife in earth for those who died in the friendship of God but still in original sin, or due to a serious matter that the deceased left pending during life, which left to the soul of said person unable to enter the heaven. The concept is controversial and is not an official doctrine of Catholicism. The word itself can also be more generally used to mean up-in-the-air or unfinished, as in the phrase "in limbo." ==Story== {{Main|/Story|l1=Story|/Translation|l2=Translation|/Characters|l3=Characters|/Stages|l4=Stages}} Strange rumors are circulating in the [[Human Village]]. ''"A dog with a human's face was rummaging in the compost pile."''
''"Somebody saw an old woman selling humans' feet."'' These pointless rumors have exploded, and driven the children into fear. Unlike the [[youkai]] whose natural purpose is to attack humans, these rumors are both unsettling and impossible to discern the truth underneath. Since there were no real victims, the adults have come to think of them as merely children's silly talks. Of course, the girls are not afraid. They know these to be the outside world's "[[Urban_Legend|urban legends]]" (made-up stories). Urban legends have an interesting property. As the circulating rumors change, the anomalies will change correspondingly. [[Reimu Hakurei|Reimu]] and company have assumed the rumors that fit them, and treat the anomalies as their playthings. As long as one can control the rumors without being afraid, the manifested anomalies can be rendered harmless. More than that, they can be turned into powers of one's own. The girls thought of controlling the urban legends by themselves as a necessary measure for keeping people from harm. This had indeed been true. Until one night... ==Music== {{Main|/Music|l1=Music}} There is a total of 30 tracks in the game. Unlike the previous fighters that had [[U2 Akiyama]] and [[ZUN]] for the music, this time other composers from different doujin groups come and made an official contribution, mainly to re-arrange characters' themes from previous Touhou games. One notable use of instrument amongst these arrangers is the guitar. To add to this, U2 (with [[JUN]] providing the violin) also provided music, mainly original themes, and ZUN created two new themes; one called "Battlefield of the Flower Threshold" as [[Kasen Ibaraki]]'s theme and "Last Occultism ~ Esotericist of the Present World" as [[Sumireko Usami]]'s. Notably, [[Reimu Hakurei]]'s theme is an arrangement of "Dichromatic Lotus Butterfly ~ Red and White" from ''[[Dolls in Pseudo Paradise]]'', itself coming from ''[[Shuusou Gyoku]]''. Unlike other fighters as well, the main scenarios don't use character themes; instead, there are new themes that are fixed specifically for these scenarios (listed under "Story Mode Battle Theme" in the link). The [[ULiL OST|Music album]] containing all the songs was later released at Comiket 88 on August 14, 2015. Later on the [[ULiL OST 2|2nd Music album]] was released on December 8, 2016. It is a follow-up to the [[Urban Legend in Limbo OST]], released as a bonus CD with the first pressing edition of the PlayStation 4 version of the game. ==Press== The game was announced by [[ZUN]] on November 16th, 2014, at Digital Game Expo 2014 alongside ''[[Danmaku Amanojaku Gold Rush]]''. Cards were handed out featuring [[Marisa Kirisame]] on a cover with references to Japanese urban myths in the background with art by [[Moe Harukawa]], along with the text "Get your hands on the Occult Ball!" On December 22nd, 2014, ZUN [https://twitter.com/korindo/status/547263752240787456 tweeted] the proper announcement of the game, and linked to [[Twilight Frontier]]'s new [http://www.tasofro.net/touhou145/index.html website] for Touhou 14.5, thus also announcing the newest [[Team Shanghai Alice]] and Tasofro collaboration. A trial version was released on December 29, 2014 during the [[Comiket 87]]. On April 11th, 2015, Tasofro announced that the game will be released on May 10th, 2015, at [[Reitaisai 12]], and revealed [[Fujiwara no Mokou]] and [[Shinmyoumaru Sukuna]] as playable characters. On February 6, 2016 during the Nikenme Radio stream, ZUN, alongside with Unabara Iruka, confirmed a PlayStation 4 release of the game with additional content. On May 9, 2016, a trailer for the PlayStation 4 version is released with the confirmation of the new returning character, [[Reisen Udongein Inaba]], with her story being said to continue after the events of Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom. On September 2, 2016, more information about the PlayStation 4 port was given. It is revealed that Reisen's theme is to be remixed by BeatMARIO. A release date of December 8, 2016 is confirmed for Japan and first print copies will include a new soundtrack for the game. HORI announced alongside the release of Urban Legend in Limbo themed Real Arcade PRO arcade sticks with the Reimu themed version being exclusively available in Amazon Japan while the Marisa themed version will be exclusive in HORI's online store at the price of ¥16,980 each. ==Gallery== File:Th145cover.jpg|Cards handed out featuring [[Marisa Kirisame]] File:Real-arcade-pro-arcade-stick.jpg|HORI's Reimu-themed Real Arcade PRO arcade stick (Amazon Japan) File:Real-arcade-pro-arcade-stick-marisa.jpg|thumb|HORI's Marisa-themed Real Arcade PRO arcade stick (HORI Online Store) File:ULiL-PlayStation-4-keyart.jpg|Artwork for the PlayStation 4 version File:Reisen-reveal.jpg|Reveal image of [[Reisen Udongein Inaba]] for the PlayStation 4 version File:TH145Demodisc.jpg|Demo Disc File:TH145disc.jpg|Game Disc ====Box Arts==== File:Th145front.jpg|Cover of the PC version File:CvRmZHVUkAAcUsz.jpg|Cover of the PS4 version ==Trailers== Tokyo Game Show 2016 (PlayStation 4) Trailer:
{{#ev:youtube|vajqc4txYU8|360}} ==Differences from the PlayStation 4 version== As ZUN stated from an interview, the PlayStation 4 version of the game will not be a direct port and will receive exclusive features. *[[Reisen Udongein Inaba]] is a playable character exclusive to the PS4 version. **Reisen occupies the "Random character" in the Character Select screen. *Extra mode is added, which takes place as Reisen's story. **The Extra Story mode also acts as a prologue to [[Antinomy of Common Flowers]]. It occurs some time after [[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]]. *[[Eientei]] is present in the game as a new stage. *The PS4 version has 1080p screen resolution support as opposed to the PC version's which only supports up to 720p. *New music tracks were remixed and added. *New modes were added. *New [[Urban Legend in Limbo OST 2|Original Soundtrack CD]] was released alongside the first copies of the game. ==Additional Information== *This game marks the first official Touhou game to be released on a console. **This is also the first official Touhou game to be multi-platform. *This is the first game to have two different covers. The silhouette in the PC version is [[Sumireko Usami]] while the PS4 version has [[Reimu Hakurei]] and [[Reisen Udongein Inaba]]. *The PlayStation 4 version marks the first official Touhou game to have a 1080p screen resolution. ==English patches== {{thcrap|th145|http://www.mediafire.com/file/3yu6ltlc7qwzccw/th145_%28thpatch-en%29.zip}} *[http://www.mediafire.com/file/v39ga9y7iob6jfj/Touhou_14_5_English_Patch_v1_41.zip Alternative English Static, v1.41 (By Team Occult)] ==External Links== *[http://www.tasofro.net/touhou145/index.html Urban Legend in Limbo official website] (Japanese) *[http://www.tasofro.net/touhou145ps4/index.html Official website for the PlayStation 4 version] *[https://store.playstation.com/#!/ja-jp/%e3%82%b2%e3%83%bc%e3%83%a0/%e6%9d%b1%e6%96%b9%e6%b7%b1%e7%a7%98%e9%8c%b2-%ef%bd%9e-urban-legend-in-limbo/cid=JP2230-CUSA06012_00-TH14500000000001?SMCID=jGMpscomheader03 PlayStation Store page (Japanese)] {{Navbox Touhou}} {{Twilight Frontier Games}} {{Navbox Play, Doujin! Fangames}} {{Navbox ULiL}} [[Category:Urban Legend in Limbo| ]] [[es:Urban Legend in Limbo]] [[fr:Urban Legend in Limbo]] [[it:Urban Legend in Limbo]] [[ko:동방심비록]] [[pt:Urban Legend in Limbo]] [[pl:Urban Legend in Limbo]] [[ru:Urban Legend in Limbo]] [[vi:Urban Legend in Limbo]] [[zh:东方深秘录]]

{{Stub}} {{Infobox Game | type = official game | titleN = {{ruby-ja|秘封|ひふう}}ナイトメアダイアリー | titleEn = Violet Detector | image = [[File:Th165cover.jpg|256px|Violet Detector]] | developer1 = [[Team Shanghai Alice]] | publisher1 = [[Team Shanghai Alice]] | publisher1Cat = Team Shanghai Alice | released = 2018/08/10 | convention = Comiket 94 | genre1 = Vertical Danmaku Photography Shooting | gameplay = Single-player Story Mode | platforms = [[Windows]] [[wikipedia:Windows 7|7]]/[[wikipedia:Windows 8|8]]/[[wikipedia: Windows 10|10]] | requirements = *Processor: Core 2 Duo or faster *Memory: 1024 MB RAM *Graphics: Shader Model 2.0 compatible *DirectX: Version 9.0c *Storage: 600 MB available space *"Sound Card: DirectSound compatible | chronology =Touhou Series | chrono_prev =[[Hidden Star in Four Seasons]] | chrono_next =[[Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]] }} {{thtitle||Hifuu|ruby=Secret Sealing| Nightmare Diary ~ Violet Detector |jp=秘封ナイトメアダイアリー 〜 Violet Detector}} is a [[danmaku]] vertical-scrolling photography game and the "16.5th" official installment of the ''[[Touhou Project]]'', featuring [[Sumireko Usami]] as the playable character and main protagonist. The game is a follow-up to ''[[Double Spoiler]]'' and ''[[Shoot the Bullet]]'', which are similar in both gameplay and concept. It was released on August 10, 2018, at [[Comiket 94]].
==Gameplay== {{Main|/Gameplay|l1=Gameplay|Violet Detector/Gameplay/Strategy|l2=Strategy|/Spell Cards|l3=Spell Cards}} ''Violet Detector'', like its predecessors ''Shoot the Bullet'', ''Double Spoiler'' and ''Impossible Spell Card'', is a collection of many individual danmaku patterns that the player can choose from at their leisure. In addition to the usual mechanic of taking photographs that clear enemy bullets, Sumireko has several psychic superpowers at her disposal, such as teleportation. The game features all of the characters who debuted in ''[[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]]'' and ''[[Hidden Star in Four Seasons]]'', plus Reimu, Marisa, and most of the final and EX bosses from previous games.
==Name and Concept== {{Stub|section}}
==Story== {{Main|/Translation|l1=Translation|/Characters|l2=Characters}} [[Sumireko Usami]], psychic teenager and frequent visitor to Gensokyo, finds herself trapped in a nightmare wherein Gensokyo's residents are relentlessly attacking her with danmaku. A frustrated Sumireko decides to make the best of the situation by photographing the danmaku patterns to share on social media, and after doing so, finds that she's been freed from the dream. Three long weeks of danmaku nightmares follow...
==Music== {{Main|/Music|l1=Music}} The soundtrack of ''Violet Detector'' features a total of eight tracks. Four of these are taken from previous games or music albums, and are all used during dialogue within a given scene. The other themes, aside from the title screen, play during any other scene.
==Press== [[ZUN]] announced the game on [https://kourindou.exblog.jp/27419239 his blog] and [https://twitter.com/korindo/status/1019839836448931840 Twitter account] on July 19, 2018. The announcement included some info about the game and its release date, and featured some screenshots showing the main screen and some of the characters.
==English patch== {{thcrap|th165|http://www.mediafire.com/file/h4a75ji4do7pc9d/th165+%28thpatch-en%29.zip}}

{{Infobox Game | type = official game | titleN = {{ruby-ja|東方鬼形獣|とうほうきけいじゅう}} | titleEn = Wily Beast and Weakest Creature | image = [[File:Th17cover.png|256px|Wily Beast and Weakest Creature cover]] | developer1 = [[Team Shanghai Alice]] | publisher1 = [[Team Shanghai Alice]] | publisher1Cat = Team Shanghai Alice | released = Trial: 2019/05/05 ([[:category:Reitaisai 16|Reitaisai 16]])
Full version: 2019/08/12 | convention = Comiket 96 | genre1 = Vertical Danmaku Shooting | gameplay = Single-Player Story Mode | platforms = [[Windows]] [[wikipedia:Windows 7|7]]/[[wikipedia:Windows 8|8]]/[[wikipedia:Windows 10|10]] | requirements ='''Steam Version''' *Core 2 Duo CPU or higher *600MB hard disk *1024MB RAM (Recommended 2048m) *Directx 9.0c | chronology =Touhou Series | chrono_prev =[[Violet Detector]] | chrono_next =[[Touhou Gouyoku Ibun]] }} {{thtitle|Touhou |Kikeijuu|ruby=[[Oni]]-Shaped Beast| ~ Wily Beast and Weakest Creature|jp=東方鬼形獣　～ Wily Beast and Weakest Creature}} is the seventeenth official installment of the ''[[Touhou Project]]''. It was announced by ZUN on his personal blog on April 17, 2019, at 14:02 JST.{{cite web|url=https://kourindou.exblog.jp/28205045/|title={{lang|ja|東方Project 第17弾です}}|author=ZUN|date=April 17, 2019|language=ja}} A playable demo was released on May 5, 2019, at [[Reitaisai|Reitaisai 16]]. The full version was released August 12, 2019, at [[Comiket|Comiket 96]]. ==Gameplay== {{Main|/Gameplay|l1=Gameplay|/Gameplay/Strategy|l2=Strategy|/Spell Cards|l3=Spell Cards|/Achievements|l4=Achievements}} There are three main characters: [[Reimu Hakurei]], [[Marisa Kirisame]], and [[Youmu Konpaku]]. The player can equip one of three animal spirits, namely "Wolf", "Otter" and "Eagle". "Wolf" powers up the player's focused shot, "Otter" powers up the player's bombs, and "Eagle" powers up the player's unfocused shot. Upon defeating certain enemies and in-between each Spell Card, items called '''Spirit Items''' will appear on screen and bounce around for a very long time, similar to [[Undefined Fantastic Object]]'s UFOs.
There are three ''Beast Spirits'' items (one for ''Wolf'', ''Otter'' and ''Eagle'') which periodically cycle in the aforementioned order. Upon collecting five ''Spirit Items'', the player enters '''Roaring Mode'''. Similarly to [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]]'s Supernatural Border mode, ''Roaring Mode'' can end by timeout, calling off or by being hit, which negates the hit. While ending ''Roaring Mode'' by timeout creates new ''Beast Items'', ending it through any other method triggers a ''Spirit Strike'' which deletes nearby bullets. All standard non-basic drops (lives, bombs, high-value power & high-value points) now also feed into this system. Triggering ''Roaring Mode'' with three or more of the same ''Beast Spirits'' will give the player special bonuses. * For three or more ''Wolf Spirits'', the player's focused shot will be improved (and shot even whilst unfocused). * For three or more ''Otter Spirits'', the player will receive an orbiting bullet shield. * For three of more ''Eagle Spirits'', the player's unfocused shot will be improved (and shot even whilst focused). Triggering such a '''Berserk Roaring Mode''' which matches your Shot Type and/or with more than three ''Beast Items'' will elongate its duration. This game sees the return of Spell Practice and marks the addition of "Achievements" to the mainline franchise. These reward completing each scenario, difficulty, 1ccs and no-miss runs.
There are also secret achievements to be found. ==Concept== In the game's preliminary description, ZUN describes it as "a shooting game that's darker than usual, full of animal elements, and just a bit aggressive." ==Story== {{Main|/Story|l1=Story|/Translation|l2=Translation|/Characters|l3=Characters}}
''Beast spirits began to invade from Hell en masse.'' ''"They're trying to take over the surface world with brute force and sheer numbers.''
''I beg of you! Venture into Hell with me, and put a stop to their plans!"'' ''So she was told, by a beast spirit that was cooperative with humans...''
Reimu, Marisa and Youmu encounter several animal spirits from [[Hell]], who claim that their fellow animal spirits are plotting to take over the surface world. The three heroines team up with the spirits, and venture into Hell to take out this new potential threat. ==Music== {{Main|/Music|l1=Music}} Wily Beast and Weakest Creature has 17 different tracks in it excluding the Player Score song, which can all be unlocked in the sound test by hearing them at least once in-game. The Stage 6 theme "Electric Heritage" is an arranged version of "Entrust the World to Idols ~ Idolatrize World", and the staff roll theme "Returning Home from the Underground" is, as is stated in the comment, an arranged version of the Stage 4 theme "Unlocated Hell". Several songs from this soundtrack aim to "''portray a Touhou-esque view''" of the afterlife, as seen in the description of "The Lamentations Known Only by Jizo" and "Everlasting Red Spider Lily". ZUN sees "The Lamentations Known Only by Jizo" as the first instance of a Stage 1 theme being not "''bright''" and "''cheery''", but rather feeling more melancholy. "Unlocated Hell" marks another self-admitted failure of an attempt at heavy metal (see [[Embodiment_of_Scarlet_Devil/Music|Sakuya's theme]]). Many of the later songs do include the now classic ZUN-electric guitar. On the note of "electric", "Electric Heritage" is one of the first songs of the Touhou Project to have a distinct "cyber" feeling. In the description of "The Shining Law of the Strong Eating the Weak", ZUN notes that he'd like to start "refining his [musical] sensibility" with his children in later games. ==Press== ''Wily Beast and Weakest Creature'' was first announced on ZUN's blog on April 17, 2019, along with information about the characters and story, and several in-development screenshots. He noted that the game would be "darker than usual" and even "a bit aggressive". The trial CD was released on May 5th, 2019, during Reitaisai 16{{cite web|url=https://kourindou.exblog.jp/28279622/|title={{lang|ja|明日は例大祭です}}|author=ZUN|date=May 4, 2019|language=ja}}. On May 20th, he announced the trial of ''Wily Beast and Weakest Creature'' would also be available on Steam{{cite web|url=https://kourindou.exblog.jp/28323776/|title={{lang|ja|東方鬼形獣の体験版を公開しました}}|author=ZUN|date=May 20, 2019|language=ja}}, which is, according to Team Shanghai Alice's legal representative Fumio Oyamada, the result of a conversation with Toby Fox.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QFEbWqs_Hh4&feature=youtu.be&t=6396|title={{lang|ja|東方ステーション #18　～例大祭特集～}}|author=ステーション東方|date=May 10, 2019|language=ja}} The game was released on August 12th, 2019, during Comiket 96, along with a bug patch{{cite web|url=https://kourindou.exblog.jp/28512725/|title={{lang|ja|夏コミ情報と重要なお知らせ }}|author=ZUN|date=August 10, 2019|language=ja}}. The Steam version of the full release was available September 10th, 2019.{{cite web|url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1079160/__Wily_Beast_and_Weakest_Creature/|title={{lang|en|東方鬼形獣 〜 Wily Beast and Weakest Creature. on Steam}}}} In the afterword, ZUN sees ''Wily Beast and Weakest Creature'' as possibly the easiest game in the series. ==Gallery== File:WBaWCCDCover.jpg.jpg|CD cover of ''Wily Beast and Weakest Creature'', and onis. File:WBaWCCDDemo.jpg|CD Demo featuring [[Eika Ebisu]]. File:WBaWCTitleScreen.jpg|Title screen. ==English patch== {{thcrap|th17|}} ==External Links== *[https://kourindou.exblog.jp/28205045/ Official announcement on ZUN's blog] *[https://store.steampowered.com/app/1079160 Steam] *[https://www.dlsite.com/home/announce/=/product_id/RJ254866.html DLsite] *[https://dlsoft.dmm.com/detail/shanghaialice_0007 DMM] ==References== {{smallrefs}} {{Navbox Touhou}} {{Navbox WBaWC}} [[Category:Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]] [[Category:Reitaisai 16]] [[zh:东方鬼形兽]] [[de:Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]] [[es:Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]] [[fr:Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]] [[pl:Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]] [[ru:Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]] [[tr:Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]] [[vi:Wily Beast and Weakest Creature]]
